ans.reasoning: The method callRealMethod() checks if the method is abstract and throws an exception if it is. The test is trying to call a real method on a spy of an abstract class, which is not allowed. This method is directly responsible for the failure.
The answer() method in CallsRealMethods attempts to call the real method on the mock. Since the method being called is abstract, this method leads to the exception being thrown.

The cannotCallAbstractRealMethod() method is invoked when an attempt is made to call a real method on an abstract class. This method is part of the exception handling and is directly related to the failure.

The spy() method is used to create a spy of the AbstractThing class. The failure occurs because the test tries to call a real method on an abstract class, which is not allowed. This method is indirectly related to the failure.
